TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IMobileWebFormServices

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Defines an interface for a page designer component to obtain services from a designer host such as Visual Studio 2005 at design time. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format: ## Remarks All methods in this interface are to be implemented by the design host and made available to designer components through this <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.MobileControls.IMobileWebFormServices> interface. Before attempting to use the methods in a custom designer component, verify that the design host actually implements the interface.

Docs.related: Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control
How to: Extend the Appearance and Behavior of Controls in Design Mode

MemberSignature.Value: public void ClearUndoStack ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ClearUndoStack() cil managed
Public Sub ClearUndoStack ()
public: void ClearUndoStack();
abstract member ClearUndoStack : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Clears all items in the designer host's **Undo** cache at design time. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Since the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.MobileControls.IMobileWebFormServices.ClearUndoStack%2A> method is implemented by the designer host, verify that it exists before invoking it.

Docs.related: Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control
How to: Extend the Appearance and Behavior of Controls in Design Mode

abstract member GetCache : string * obj -> obj

Docs.param: The ID for the container control.
The key for the cache item.
Docs.summary: Gets an item from the cache of the designer host at design time. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.returns: An object from the cache of the designer host.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Since the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.MobileControls.IMobileWebFormServices.GetCache%2A> method is implemented by the designer host, verify that it exists before invoking it.

Docs.related: Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control
How to: Extend the Appearance and Behavior of Controls in Design Mode

Docs.summary: Refreshes the page in the designer host at design time. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Since the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.MobileControls.IMobileWebFormServices.RefreshPageView%2A> method is implemented by the designer host, verify that it exists before invoking it.

MemberSignature.Value: public void UpdateRenderingRecursive (System.Web.UI.Control rootControl);

Docs.param: The container control with which to begin the update.
Docs.summary: Recursively updates the associated control and each of its child controls in the design host at design time. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.related: Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control
How to: Extend the Appearance and Behavior of Controls in Design Mode
